P-4 P4116 Nissan Turbo Violet 1974 Fuji Skakedown



Turbocharging was just starting to be used by Japanese manufacturers in the early 1970s. Toyota had used the technology on the twin-turbo Toyota 7 in 1970 and on the Fuji 1000km winning Celica LB in 1973. One of Nissan’s early turbocharged racers was the 710 series Violet. The first turbo Violet began testing at Fuji in January 1974. After many successful tests, the effects of the 1973 oil crisis hit Japanese motorsports so the Violet was raced abroad. This is P-4’s model of the Violet used in that initial testing.
